images.place: Eat Every Grain, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Black tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_tea) is one of the more fermented and stronger-tasting teas. The tea was called “black tea” by European traders, who named it after the color of the leaves, although the brewed tea has a reddish hue (and in Chinese is called *red tea*, while *black tea* in Chinese refers to post-fermented teas like Pu'er tea).

**Origin Story**

Black tea was invented relatively recently in the seventeenth century. according to legend, after traveling soldiers interrupted production at a tea factory, prompting the producers to dry the leaves over pine-cone fires.

**Characters**

[紅](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%B4%85) is *red*, and [茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8C%B6) is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea), so [紅茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%B4%85%E8%8C%B6) is *red tea*.

In Japanese, the [kanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanji) [紅茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%B4%85%E8%8C%B6#Japanese) refers to non-Japanese tea.

images.place: Tea Grotto, Salt Lake City, Utah

description:
[Golden Monkey tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Monkey_tea) is a black tea featuring golden tips and resembling the shape of a monkey paw, hence the name (also Monkey Paw tea)

**Characters**

[金](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%87%91) is *gold*, [猴](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%8C%B4) is short for *monkey*, and [茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8C%B6) is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea).

images.place: Tea Grotto, Salt Lake City, Utah

description:
Keemun is a well-known black tea, one of the [Chinese Top Ten Famous Teas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Chinese_teas#Ten_Famous_Teas).

Keemun black tea is often used in English breakfast tea (which is any black tea drunk with breakfast).

**Characters**

[祁門](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/祁門) is [Qimen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keemun) (Keemun is an old Anglicization), the county in Anhui province of China where the tea is producted, and [紅茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%B4%85%E8%8C%B6) is black tea (“red tea”).

images.place: Eat Every Grain, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Lapsang souchong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lapsang_souchong), also known as *smoked tea* due to the smoke-fired preparation that lends to its flavor, is a black tea from the Wuyi region of the Fujian province in China.

**Trivia***

Sir Patrick Stewart initially suggested lapsang souchong as his character Jean-Luc Picard's preferred tea, but it was decided that Earl Grey was more safely recognizable by the Star Trek audience. However, lapsang souchong is the preferred tea of Sherlock Holmes.
